response28.text:
Batch recompile, Load a song, and Batch process, all rebuild the songs from scratch, losing all metadata originally associated with the song.
This means the song will not be correct for leaderboards, online play, or dx song upgrades (harmonies, pro upgrades, rb4 chart updates).
**Never recompile songs already existing in Rock Band format back to Rock Band.**

response38.text:
If you are playing BetterGH3 and you can't find the ''calibrate'', this is due to game restrictions not allowing automatic calibration with the audio and video lag options being separate.
You will have to calibrate manually, you can watch this video to learn how.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFwn-2V_vIQ

response72.text: I feel like practice mode is a way of cheating. You play to play the game, not to FC everything. And you can still FC it by practising the song all over again. Practice mode just takes away the momentum and the charm. It may be frustrating, but that's how it is.

response74.text:
1. Download [vkDiag tool](https://github.com/13xforever/vkdiag/releases/latest) from GitHub.
2. Run the tool and post a screenshot of the results.

This tool is useful for resolving Vulkan related driver issues, such as:
- Receiving an error relating to `vulkan-1.dll` on startup.
- Vulkan renderer not appearing.
- Receiving a segfault relating to some .dll file that RPCS3 does not use, such as `nvoglv64.dll` or `bdcamvk64.dll`.

response76.text:
Your cache files may become problematic as RPCS3 updates to improve emulation quality. You can force RPCS3 to generate new ones by removing them.
Simply right click Rock Band 3 in RPCS3's game list then go to `Remove` and select which cache to remove. You can also remove all caches.

response107.text:
Having issues with your Xbox One instrument?
Go to `Start` > `Settings`  > `Apps` > `Installed apps`
Look for `Microsoft GameInput` and uninstall the latest version.
Please note that it may reinstall itself after a reboot.

response115.text:
## How to play Vanilla Guitar Hero PC on a keyboard without strumming
**Translated version of a guide written by Naonemeu.**

1. Download Xoutput - <https://github.com/csutorasa/XOutput>

2. **Before opening Xoutput**, download the needed dependencies:
  * [ViGEmBus](<https://github.com/nefarius/ViGEmBus/releases>)
  * [DirectX](<https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35>)
  * [.NET 7 ASP.NET and Desktop runtime](<https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/7.0>)

3. Open xoutput.exe
4. In the 'Game Controllers' section , click 'Edit'

5. In the controls window, remap your keys according to this:
```LT is Green
LB is Red
RB is Yellow
RT is Blue
A  is Orange.
Map D-Pad to the arrow keys
'Back' is Star Power
'RX' is whammy (configure your deadzone to make it not distort all the time)```
-# RX is Right Joystick on the X axis

B is back, X is Bonus and Y is Setlist.

At the end of the tab, click Start controller with the program.
6. Click on Start to start your virtual controller, and run your game.
